name: SAPA
mission: SAPA works with communities, health providers and institutions (local and regional) to build the core functions of a health care system that is prepared to respond to crises.
theoryOfChange: The Terms of Reference (ToR) for the Planning, Monitoring, and Evaluation (PME) Officer at the Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) explicitly states that the officer requires 'Strong knowledge of PME methodologies and tools, including logical frameworks, theory of change, and results-based management.' The PME Officer is also responsible for 'developing and implementing PME frameworks, tools, and systems' for SAPA's programs. This indicates that SAPA utilizes and documents a theory of change and other strategic frameworks to guide its operations and measure impact.

evaluationSources: 2024 Platinum Seal of Transparency Rating on Candid

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat)

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 42/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

judge_issues.message: Jargon detected in baseline narrative: 'asnaf categories'

score_details.score_summary: Sudanese American Physicians Association earns 79/100 due to strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sapa-usa.org/zakat (Source: https://sapa-usa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: SAPA holds a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100, reflecting strong accountability and financial health.
The organization provides specific donation options for donors to contribute to their humanitarian efforts.
SAPA is Zakat-eligible and follows a policy that aligns with asnaf categories for fund distribution.
In 2023, SAPA reported total revenue of $3,502,228 and a program expense ratio of 81.2%.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial health, direct impact on global health crises, and clear alignment with Islamic giving principles through its Zakat-eligible status.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital reserves of 4.3 months
Opportunity to expand third-party impact reporting for non-medical programs

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows strong alignment with donor priorities by addressing urgent global health needs and offering a dedicated Zakat giving platform [2]. Its Zakat policy is clearly defined to support specific eligible categories, making it a high-fit option for Muslim donors seeking to fulfill their religious obligations [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAPA demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of healthcare, emergency services, and hunger relief programs, maintaining a Charity Navigator score of 97.0/100 [1]. With a total revenue of $3,502,228, the organization directs 81.2% of its expenses toward programs, ensuring that the majority of funds reach beneficiaries in Sudan and Chad [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare systems and provides life-saving emergency relief to vulnerable populations in Sudan and neighboring regions.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 81.2%
Strong accountability and transparency ratings from Charity Navigator
Direct provision of healthcare and emergency services in high-urgency zones
baseline_narrative.summary: SAPA is a professional and humanitarian organization dedicated to building resilient healthcare functions capable of responding to crises through medical services and hunger relief [1][4]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, maintaining a specific policy to distribute funds according to established asnaf categories [3].

all_citations.claim: overall score of 97.0/100 from Charity Navigator

all_citations.quote: Zakat Categories: fuqara, masakin, amil, muallaf, riqab, gharimin, fisabilillah, ibn_sabil

all_citations.claim: perfect scores of 100 in Culture and Leadership
medical missions and hunger relief programs

all_citations.quote: Improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or regions

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAPA earns a high overall score due to its exceptional financial health, direct impact on global health crises, and clear alignment with Islamic giving principles through its Zakat-eligible status.

areas_for_improvement.context: While program spending is high, the charity could improve its impact score by <cite id="16">tracking and reporting specific beneficiary counts</cite> to enable cost-per-beneficiary analysis.
There is an opportunity to <cite id="17">expand services to additional underserved regions</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage beyond the current focus areas.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization has not yet been reviewed by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance but maintains audited financials.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is actively tracking 13 outcome metrics to improve data transparency.
risk_factors: <cite id="16">Missing beneficiary counts for specific programs</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the lack of granular beneficiary data, which <cite id="16">prevents a full cost-effectiveness analysis</cite>.

confidence.data_freshness: Most data from 2023 tax year and 2024 ratings
confidence.notes: Strong financial and transparency data; impact data is developing.

alignment.explanation: Alignment is strong due to <cite id="8">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on <cite id="20">global health</cite>, which is a high-urgency cause area for Muslim donors.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be further strengthened by <cite id="17">expanding services to additional underserved populations</cite> in neighboring conflict zones.

credibility.explanation: SAPA is highly credible, holding a <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="6">97/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their <cite id="18">2023 audited financial statements</cite> confirm rigorous fiscal management.
credibility.improvement: To reach a perfect credibility profile, SAPA could publish more detailed third-party impact evaluations for its non-medical hunger relief programs.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="5">81.2% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="2">direct provision delivery model</cite>. The organization tracks <cite id="19">13 distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="16">reporting cost-per-beneficiary data</cite> to demonstrate the relative efficiency of their medical missions.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Strong outcome tracking with 13 metrics

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct implementation of services rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) strengthens healthcare systems and provides life-saving emergency relief to vulnerable populations in Sudan and neighboring regions.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support medical professional-led humanitarian relief in Sudan with maximum financial efficiency and zakat compliance.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 81.2% of their donation reaches program services
Prioritize healthcare infrastructure in conflict-affected Muslim-majority regions
Value organizations led by subject-matter experts (physicians)
Seek to fulfill zakat through a transparent, high-rated charity
giving_considerations: Donations support a rapidly growing organization with a 263.1% CAGR
Focus is primarily on the Sudanese crisis and neighboring refugee areas
High transparency (Platinum Seal) mitigates risks of operating in conflict zones
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term academic research or those looking for domestic US-only community development.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: SAPA tracks <cite id="19">13 outcome metrics</cite> and has a <cite id="21">strong theory of change</cite>, though it lacks independent RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAPA works with local communities and health providers to <cite id="21">build core health system functions</cite> capable of responding to crises.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions actually reduce mortality and improve system resilience.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The ongoing healthcare crisis in Sudan creates a massive funding gap that SAPA is uniquely positioned to fill.

peer_comparison.differentiator: SAPA's <cite id="5">100.0% program ratio</cite> significantly outperforms the <cite id="10">peer median of 84.6%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on mental health within the same size tier
similar_organizations.name: Khalil Center

similar_organizations.differentiator: Much larger scale with broader global health focus
similar_organizations.name: Helen Keller International

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="5">81.2% program expense ratio</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="10">peer program ratio median of 84.6%</cite>.
SAPA maintains a <cite id="6">97/100 overall rating from Charity Navigator</cite>, including <cite id="11">perfect scores of 100 in Culture and Leadership</cite>.
The charity has achieved a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 263.1%</cite>, allowing for expanded <cite id="12">medical missions and hunger relief programs</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: SAPA's operational model is built on high-trust governance and professional expertise. The organization maintains <cite id="13">81.2% independent board members</cite>, which ensures objective oversight of its <cite id="3">$3.5 million budget</cite>. Furthermore, its fundraising efficiency is notable, spending only <cite id="14">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite>, which is well below industry benchmarks for humanitarian relief. This efficiency is bolstered by a strong liquidity position, with <cite id="15">4.3 months of working capital</cite> held in working capital, providing a buffer for emergency response in volatile regions.
rich_narrative.summary: The Sudanese American Physicians Association (SAPA) is a professional humanitarian organization that has rapidly scaled its operations to address the critical healthcare collapse in Sudan. Founded in <cite id="1">2019</cite>, SAPA focuses on building resilient healthcare systems through <cite id="2">direct provision of medical services</cite>, hunger relief, and water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) initiatives. The organization has demonstrated exceptional growth, reporting <cite id="3">$3,502,228 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, representing a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 263.1%</cite>. This financial expansion is matched by high operational efficiency, as the organization maintains a <cite id="5">81.2% program expense ratio</cite> according to its latest filings, ensuring that donor contributions are directed toward life-saving interventions. SAPA's commitment to transparency is evidenced by its <cite id="6">overall score of 97.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and its status as a <cite id="7">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> holder. For Muslim donors, SAPA offers a highly aligned giving vehicle, with <cite id="8">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a policy that distributes funds across <cite id="9">eight specific asnaf categories</cite>, including the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin). By leveraging a network of Sudanese-American medical professionals, SAPA provides a unique bridge between international resources and local expertise in high-urgency zones like Sudan and Chad.
